definition: half of the country (esp. when half the country has fallen into enemy hands)/vast swathe of territory
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Fannie and Freddie account for half of all mortgages in the US.
sentences.chinese: 房利美和房地美占据了美国抵押贷款的半壁江山。

sentences.english: The littlest knight married her and got half the kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 小小骑士迎娶了公主，分得半壁江山。

sentences.english: About half the electricity consumed in this country is produced in coal-fired power plants.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，烧煤的发电厂支撑着国家用电量的半壁江山。

definition: lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
